My version of Pyrrhonism denies that any particular contrast class is the relevant one in the sense that believers need to rule out all alternatives in that class in order to be justified without qualification. That view might seem to conflict with my claim here that moral beliefs need inferential confirmation. However, there might be no need to rule out any particular contrast class, even if there is a need to give evidence of a certain kind
